phrases: That is what goes through my mind, every day, after I confirm it.
At school, at home, at my job,
Ray of Hope For Civilian Antarctic Expedition?
Shichishin-ya to Sign Contract to Sponsor Challenge For Antarctic?
We got some tickets for this, so if you are interested, come see management.
I say it over and over again.
It is not as if they would believe me right now anyway.
I will say it after I have really gone,
In your face, in your face, in your face!
You are kind of a jerk, you know.
A Place Further Than the Universe
Always check the lower door before and after closing the freezer door
You need two days off for this summer training,
and then you will be taking time off beginning in December?
What do your parents have to say?

I hereby grant permission as guardian of your student (Kobuchizawa Shirase) for them to take the following time off: (Student's Class) Year 2 Class 2 (Student Name) Kobuchizawa Shirase (Guardian Name) Kobuchizawa Koumi
To join the Civilian Antarctic Expedition Challenge For Antarctic team and...
She did not slam the refrigerator door,
and the rhythm of her chopping seems normal...
Like it is all a front, to trick us...
Could you take them to the bathroom?
No, it might just be a coincidence...
If I jump to conclusions, I might be digging my own grave.
If she does, then trying to hide it might make the situation worse!
Maybe I should be just come clean, and
Or is there something on your mind?
The truth is, I have decided to take a trip this winter...
Oh, that is a done deal, is it?
I simply had not heard a thing about it!
Not until a neighbor told me today.
W-Well, I meant to tell you...

I hereby grant permission as guardian of your student (Tamaki Mari) for them to take the following time off: (Student's Class) Year 2 Class 3 (Student Name) Tamaki Mari (Guardian Name) Tamaki Yoko To join the Civilian Antarctic Expedition Challenge For Antarctic team...
It was just an issue of t-t-timing, and we needed to be sure it was happening...
At least put down the weapon!
Though I could use it to dish out something to a certain idiot daughter of mine...
That is a terrifying thing to say!
This is pretty much all on you, Kimari.
You do not have to sum it all up like that!
Now I cannot go unless I pass every single test!
And even without that, I will not have any time to study during our training camp...
You are really taking time off next week, then?
Yeah, it is four days, including the weekend, so I will be off through Tuesday.
Are you sure about all this?
I read that they are not even sure if the boat will leave the harbor.
Well, it is not like I can do anything about that...
I got to get to my job!
If you work too hard and it does not go through, you are really going to regret it.
Standardized Test Guide High School 2 English
Look, going to school means you are taking classes, right?
That means you have got tons of time allotted every day just for learning.
If you still cannot do it, you are probably just not putting in the work.
Anyone can pick this stuff up if they try.
I was at work last time.
I had to dress that way.
I just look awful in that cutesy stuff, anyway.
I cannot stand that Look at me, I am a girly-girl!
Why is she in such a bad mood?
Well, her job being what it is,
she probably deals with some complicated stuff.
Sorry that it was not the easiest place to find.
Oh, do not worry, I will tidy it up!
This is not quite what I was expecting...
Not quite what you were expecting, huh?
Yeah, I guess it would not be.
An Antarctic expedition is a very big project.
Even if we are civilians, you would not expect a junky old minivan.
How are we supposed to respond to that?
But I never thought you would manage to end up coming with us.
What happened to your million yen?
You do not need it, do you?
As I am sure you have read, we do not have any money.
So we are doing a whole lot to raise the funds to get to Antarctica.
That also means we are trimming every bit of fat that we can.
We will not let it be canceled.
Civilian Japanese Antarctic Expedition Challenge for Antarctic (2nd) Sponsor Recruitment
You girls might not know this,
but we have been hearing the same thing over and over since the project started.
Icebreaker Shirase Recruiting naming rights partners!!
You do not have the money.
Any time one of those reports comes out,
the rest of the team and I all shout together...
Though we will not be going out there until two days from now.
Today and tomorrow, it is all lectures.
Discovery of large numbers of meteorites
The collection of meteorites across the world...
The world's largest collection of meteorites.
Among them, we have located nine Mars meteorites and nine Moon meteorites.
Based on that documentation, I will be giving you a condensed version
of the summer and winter training the others get.
Antarctica is the only continent in the world with no permanent inhabitants.
Joint International Expeditions Under the Antarctic Treaty System
Countries participating in Antarctic expeditions: 29 Wintering stations: 20
Queen Maud Land Antarctic Treaty System
it has many rules surrounding its use.
I want you to be sure to memorize them all.
You are not like this in school...
You are not in my class!
Well, let us meet the team captain!
I am this Antarctic expedition's captain, Todo Gin.
Whether the members of my team are researchers or just accompanying us,
I will treat you all the same.
We have many things to accomplish.
Just because you are in high school does not mean I will not ask you to do everything,
from laundry to hard labor, as necessary.
A: Always follow procedure B: Be alert at all times C: Common sense!
These are the ABCs of an antarctic expedition.
B: Be alert at all times.
I want you to keep these in mind at all time.
She sure did sound like a real captain, huh?
If you dozed off around her, you would have chalk coming your way, for sure.
If we had a test, I bet she would fill it with all the hardest questions.
We are surveying a route tomorrow, right?
Yeah, we will be going outside.
It would be a waste not to, being up here in the mountains and all!
Still, this all looks pretty tough.
Seeing her again after so long.
I told you, did not I?
I am going to treat her like any other member of the team.
Did you go against my wishes on purpose?
No, I did not have any part of this.
That girl really got here through her own efforts.
Though I must admit, I had a feeling she would...
Since the first day she told me she wanted to come along.
She is Takako's daughter, after all.
This is a compass, and that is a GPS...
And then we have got flags.
Yeah, she taught us most of it to us yesterday.
But why do we have to do this?
We can get along fine without marking a route, cannot we?
The landscape's white as far as you can see,
so it is easy lose track of your direction in a blizzard.
That is why you need to create a route to walk along.
So we set up the flags to serve as landmarks, huh?
But where do we put them?
Figuring that out is the point of the training.
So we just have to get there?
But we cannot just go right there.
We have to go here, here, and here on the way,
and set up flags at each point.
We cannot just run off willy-nilly.
Do you even know where the points are?
We will need to keep precise track of our location.
I am getting the feeling this is going to be hard.
I think you go like this...
It seems further away than the last one, does not it?
If the instruments are right, we should be right here, I think.
That is where they are, huh?
This reminds me of the first time I took part in one of these.
What is the story on the other three?
Well, the one is the girl we were supposed to bring along from the start, right?
They seem to have become friends at some point, but...
She said the other expedition members would compete on time, but...
I think precision is more important than speed.
I am impressed you could tell, though.
Kimari must be good with the compass.
She does seem cut out for it!
Just call me a compass expert.
Okay, I will take this one!
Feels like we are on a field trip!
We are not here to play around!
Sleeping in a tent will be good training, too.
But it is not even 8:00 yet!
Come on, the captain said they would always socialize at night during their training camps...
I could just kill you right now.
Yuzuki-chan, do you not like scary stories?
What does shut talking now mean?
You are my senpai, so I self-corrected!
You knew what I meant, so please leave me alone!
She and my mother knew each other in high school.
She went to Antarctica with my mother.
Because... my mother is waiting there.
Um, were supposed to trace something from the Big Dipper, are not we?
There is, but you cannot see it as clearly, I have heard.
You cannot see it from here, duh.
Never think the stars you see are all the stars there are.
Yeah, that one kind of sucked, huh?
Aurora Team, do you read me?
We read you loud and clear.
All personnel and equipment accounted for.
It gets cold around dawn, so watch your body temperature.
All I can say about her is that she was very strange.
I do not know her daughter very well.
But in stubbornness and conviction, she is her spitting image.
Is not trouble just the best?
A personality like yours will do well in Antarctica.
Why do you want to go to Antarctica?
But I am the one who made the decision.
That I wanted to go with her.
That I did not want my high school years to end the way they were going.
That I wanted to go somewhere that is not here.
But then I met Hinata-chan and Yuzuki-chan,
and I got to hear how the members of the expedition felt,
and I learned stuff about you and Shirase-chan, and now...
It is not just somewhere to me.
I am going to go to Antarctica with all of you...
I am not a morning person...
I want to go with all of you.
I want to find the South Star with all of you.
I want to see auroras, eat shaved ice,
